alert.note: Alert for Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 2:46AM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Missoula County through 315 AM MDT... At 246 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lolo, or 10 miles southwest of Missoula, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Lolo, and East Missoula. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 103 and 108. Highway 93 S between mile markers 82 and 94. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region
